Description: The Tribulations of St Antony; the saint is in mid-air, tormented by demons. c.1469-73 Engraving
Curator's comments: Stogdon notes that some impressions of the first state of this print are watermarked with paper used 1469-73 (see Hollstein Introduction), but it is unclear whether this comment refers to the watermark visible here - a small bull's head, possibly with a star (illegible due to repair in paper).
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / German engravings, etchings and woodcuts c.1400-1700 (54.I)
Lehrs 1908-34 / Geschichte und kritische Katalog des deutschen, niederländischen und französischen Kupferstichs im XV Jahrhundert (V.243.54.I)
Exhibition history: 1996 Sep-Nov, Manchester, Manchester City AG, 'The Inner Eye' 1996/7 Nov-Jan, Brighton, Museum and AG, 'The Inner Eye' 1997 Jan-Mar, Swansea, Glynn Vivian AG, 'The Inner Eye' 1997 Apr-Jun, London, Dulwich Picture Gallery, 'The Inner Eye' 2005 April-July, Seoul Arts Centre, 'BM Treasures...' 2005 July-Oct, Korea, Busan Museum, 'BM Treasures...' 2005/6 Oct-Jan, Daegu, Keimyung Univ. Museum, 'BM Treasures...'
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Richard Fisher (Lugt 2204; sale Sotheby's 23.v.1892)
